edu.ucla.sspace.matrix.factorization
Class NonNegativeMatrixFactorizationOPL

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.matrix.factorization.NonNegativeMatrixFactorizationOPL
All Implemented Interfaces:
MatrixFactorization
public class NonNegativeMatrixFactorizationOPL
extends Object
implements MatrixFactorization

A simple implementation of Non-Negative Matrix Factorization. This is an implementation of the Oblique Projected Landweber Method explained in

R Zdunek and A. Cichocki, (2008), "Fast Nonnegative Matrix Factorization Algorithms Using Projected Gradient Approaches for Lage-Scale Problems," Intell. Neuroscience, vol. 2008, here

NOTE: Does not work yet. Returns 0 matrices.

Author:
Keith Stevens

          By default, use this many iterations.
static String ITERATIONS
          The System Property used to define the number of gradient iterations used when decomposing a matrix.

          The base property prefix.
 
Constructor Summary
NonNegativeMatrixFactorizationOPL()
          Instantiates a new NonNegativeMatrixFactorizationOPL that uses the system default Properties to determnine the number of iterations to use when decomposing matrices.
NonNegativeMatrixFactorizationOPL(int numIterations)
          Instantiates a new NonNegativeMatrixFactorizationOPL instance which will use numIterations to compute the decomposed matrices.
NonNegativeMatrixFactorizationOPL(Properties props)
          Instantiates a new NonNegativeMatrixFactorizationOPL that uses the provided Properties to determnine the number of iterations to use when decomposing matrices.

Method Detail

factorize

public void factorize(MatrixFile mFile,
                      int numDimensions)
Factorizes the MatrixFile m. If m is of size MxN, this will generate two matrices: one of size MxnumDimensions and one of size numDimensionsxN. This method must be called before calling dataClasses and classFeatures.

Specified by:
factorize in interface MatrixFactorization

factorize

public void factorize(SparseMatrix m,
                      int numDimensions)
Factorizes the SparseMatrix m. If m is of size MxN, this will generate two matrices: one of size MxnumDimensions and one of size numDimensionsxN. This method must be called before calling dataClasses and classFeatures.

Specified by:
factorize in interface MatrixFactorization

dataClasses

public Matrix dataClasses()
Returns the data point by latent class Matrix. This matrix represents the degree by which each data point can be explained by the discovered latent classes. Actual interpretations of the latent classes depends on the actual algorithm used. This Matrix can be used as a reduced representation of the data points themselves.

Specified by:
dataClasses in interface MatrixFactorization

classFeatures

public Matrix classFeatures()
Returns the latent class by feature Matrix. This matrix represents the degree by which each feature affects each latent class. Actual interpretations of this interaction depends on the actual algorithm used. This Matrix can be used as a reduced representation of the features.

Specified by:
classFeatures in interface MatrixFactorization

getBuilder

public MatrixBuilder getBuilder()
Returns a MatrixBuilder that is optimized for MatrixFiles that will be processed by this MatrixFactorization algorithm.

Specified by:
getBuilder in interface MatrixFactorization

makeNonZero

public static void makeNonZero(Matrix m)
Sets any negative values of m to zero.

initialize

public static void initialize(Matrix m)
Initializes every value in m to be a random value between 0 and 1, inclusive.
